TopicTitle: Got my Rhino/MK3 SSTO into orbit at last. (or SSTMun?)

Articles.Content:
I don't know if it's 1.0.3 or just my stubborn persistence over the last few days.

At least the remaining dV should get me to Mun and back. 

It's still not finished - that was the first successful test launch. Now I'll add RCS, parachutes, solar and all the necessities - currently it's pretty bare-bones (doesn't even have anything on the nose - I could really have put a nose cone there...). I really don't want to try horizontal landing with this huge cow, but with "powered landing" (descent slowed by jets and held vertical by parachute) the landing on landing struts should work okay. If anything, the engines will serve as crumple zone. (I have one such lander already; would hit the ground at dangerous speed but smashing the engine to smithereens saves the cabin and payload.)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/UhoK6)

I'll post a mission report if I get to the Mun and back.

ps. performed a horizontal landing somewhere in the grasslands. That was long and arduous, and involved switching three upper rows of jet engines off manually as it just won't keep its nose up at less than 200m/s. (and with four jets operating at full power it was losing speed in horizontal flight...) The braking itself took a good three minutes - this thing is HEAVY.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T21:19:17Z" title="06/23/2015 09:19  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by Sharpy**
